intro: Afrardisia platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are broad and flat, giving it its common name, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Afrardisia platyphylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
